title: 106_s256
content: The Medicare Universal Product Number Act of 1999 requires the accommodation of universal product numbers on Medicare claims forms for reimbursement under the Medicare program. All claims forms must accommodate the use of universal product numbers for covered items by February 1, 2001. The Medicare Universal Product Number Act of 1999 mandates the inclusion of universal product numbers on Medicare claims for reimbursement. No payment will be made without the universal product number of the covered item. Covered items include those defined in specific sections and any other item deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Medicare Universal Product Number Act of 1999 requires universal product numbers on Medicare claims for reimbursement. Covered items must have a universal product number affixed by the manufacturer, based on industry standards. The Secretary determines which items are considered covered. The Secretary of Health and Human Services, in consultation with experts, determines the descriptive information for a universal product number for UPN covered items. They also review UPN covered items billed under the Medicare program to ensure proper coding and reimbursement. The amendment made by subsection (b) applies to reimbursement claims submitted on or after February 1, 2002. SEC. 3. STUDY AND REPORTS TO CONGRESS. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will conduct a study on the implementation results of certain provisions and submit progress reports to Congress within specified timeframes. The Secretary will report study results and recommendations on universal product numbers and data usage. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines "UPN covered item" and "universal product number" as per the Social Security Act. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Sums are authorized for carrying out specified provisions of the Act.
